questions.question: She is ……………. young to know better.
It is far …………… hot to go out now.
questions.description: We cannot use too much or too many before adjectives without nouns.

questions.question: We arrived …………….. late to watch the show.
questions.description: We cannot use too much or too many before adjectives without nouns.

questions.question: It is ……………. early for the shops to be open.
questions.description: We cannot use too much before adverbs.

questions.question: The tea is too hot …………..
questions.description: Objects are usually omitted after the infinitive in this construction.

questions.question: The tea is too hot for us …………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are possible after the infinitive in structures with for.

questions.question: You are ……………… young to live on your own.
questions.description: Most expressions that can modify comparatives can also modify too.

questions.question: I could not lift the bag because it was ………………. heavy.
questions.description: We cannot use too much or too many before adjectives without nouns.

questions.question: He does not like …………………..
questions.description: We cannot use too before adjective + noun.

questions.question: You put ……………… sugar in the tea.
questions.description: We use too much before uncountable nouns.

questions.question: I am getting ……………….. calls from marketers these days
questions.description: We use too many before countable nouns.

questions.question: You will look more beautiful if you stop wearing ……………….. make-up.
questions.description: We use too much before uncountable nouns.
